Community News Sep Oct 2002

06 Nov 2002

Another couple of months gone, another stack of accomplishments by the\nevolt.org community. As a reminder, this is open to anyone in the\ncommunity, so if you missed a chance to toot your horn, add a\ncomment, and watch for the announcement for next month's news.

\n

evolt.org

A new supporter has stepped forward to help support evolt.org.

To assist us in defraying our operating costs, NetWorth Enterprises,\nInc. is offering an affiliate hosting program to evolt.org members.

For every member who chooses to host one or more web sites with\nNetWorth's hosting service, evolt.org will receive 10% of the monthly\nhosting fee.

If you're looking for a hosting company, please consider NetWorth's\nhosting service. NetWorth will be changing the name and enhancing\nservices, but in the\nmeantime, the temporary domain (ez-profits.com) will\nhelp evolt.org right now.

If you want to know more about the connection between NetWorth and\nevolt.org, please read this explanation.

Evoltspottings

All over the web, people are looking to see what evolters have to\nsay, and sometimes they point their users back to the source. Here are\nsome of the pointers, all noticed this month:

    \n
  • Evolt.org mailing lists were mentioned on the Acknowledgements page in Christina Wodtke's recently released book "Information Architecture: Blueprints for the Web".
    • \n
  • Shirley Singh's article on volunteerism and the Internet mentions evolt.org and quotes some of its members in her article at rediff.com See the second part in particular.
    • \n
  • Tara Clevland's article on Accessibility Laws in Canada was mentioned on the ACM's CHI-WEB mailing list.
    • \n

Thanks to the many people who have taken the time to cite evolt.org\nin their own work

\n

Help support evolt.org

We're now again able to accept monetary gifts through:
\n

\n \n \n \n \n \n

Our address for monetary gifts or giving inquiries is give@evolt.org. We will\nsoon have a snail mail address (for checks, money orders, etc.).

We're looking for other on-line, commercial (in other words,\nnot personal bank account), low-cost money\ntransferring capabilities so that non-US residents may more easily\nhelp support evolt.org. Please write\nus if you know of any good commercial services in your\ncountry.

Here's more information on how to help support\nevolt.org. Thanks for your interest!

Our members

aardvark, mrnick, and isaac

Contributed a large amount of material to the new book Professional Web Graphics for Non Designers.

Bill Mason

My evolt article ("A revised method of defining link pseudo-classes") was cited in the TopStyle Blog.

I also participated in the Accessibility Internet Rally on September 21st, as one of a team of developers building (from scratch in 9 hours) an accessible web site for a local nonprofit group. Our team won third place!

Burhan Khalid

I recently attended the Region 3 AITP Conference in San Antonio. This is a conference where student chapters (like mine) -- go and compete against other universities. Last year, I won second place is website design (thanks to thelist for making me wanting to learn more about web "design" as opposed to web "coding"). This year, I got honorable mention in C++. The contest was held on the 1st (of November).

David Shadovitz

The ColdFusion Developers Journal published an article I wrote\n(http://www.sys-con.com/coldfusion/articlea.cfm?id=506) which is based\non code on my evolt-hosted site,\nhttp://members.evolt.org/dshadovi/.

At the tail end of the article I thank evolt for hosting the\nsite.

Lachlan Cannon

Lachlan recently had his Inline XML article published on A List Apart.

isaac

One of the original founders and main designers of evolt.org, isaac has launched a couple new Web sites: http://www.adelaide36ers.com/ and http://www.australianholidaycentre.com.au/.

Submissions

The evolt.org Monthly Recap is a summary of awards, meetings, and\nfresh opportunities relevant to all of us. Submitted items from month\nto month may be of varying relevance to others depending on the number\nof opportunities. The important thing, though, is that you can share\nmore about yourself, and learn more about the people that make up the evolt.org Monthly Recap introductory\narticle.

If you're proud of it, send it\nin. Don't be shy.

Please send all submissions via the contact form. Any queries or\nclarifications can be sent via the same method.
